net.ligreto.data
Class DataProvider

java.lang.Object
  net.ligreto.data.DataProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
ResultSetDataProvider, SortingDataProvider
public abstract class DataProvider
extends java.lang.Object

This is the class defining the interface to various data providers. It is expected that that data provided identifies the rows that have duplicates in the columns specified as key. These rows with duplicate values in key columns could be identified by hasDuplicateKey() method and should be thus processed separately. 

 DataProvider dp = new DataProvider(...);
 while (dp.next()) {
   while (dp.isValid() && dp.hasDuplicateKey) {
        // here process the rows having duplicate values
        // in the key columns
   }
   // here process the rows having unique values
   // in key columns
 }
Key columns should not have duplicates from their definition but the key columns specified are only what we expect to be the key. The duplicates are an error that should be processed in a separate way.

Author:
Julius Stroffek

getColumnCount

public abstract int getColumnCount()
                            throws DataException
Returns the number of columns of the data provider. All the rows that are returned have the same number of columns.

Returns:
the number of columns.
Throws:
DataException - if any data access error occurred.

getOriginalIndex

public abstract int getOriginalIndex(int index)
                              throws DataException
Returns the original index of the specified column. Data provider can exclude columns that it gets from the underlying data source. This method returns the index used for the column in the underlying data source. If there are more data providers chained as data sources, this method will get called internally through the whole chain. The index returned will be the value that the inner most data provider returns.

Parameters:
index - the index of the column in the data provider
Returns:
the original index including the excluded columns
Throws:
DataException

getIndex

public abstract int getIndex(int originalIndex)
                      throws DataException
This is the reverse operation to getOriginalIndex method.

Parameters:
originalIndex - the original index including the excluded columns
Returns:
the index of the column in the data provider
Throws:
DataException
See Also:
